description.narrative: The PDO under the AF was slightly revised to strengthen the Recipients local development planning and implementation capacities, tosupport the targeted population in improving agriculture productivity, and to respond promptly and effectively to an eligible crisis or emergency.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Planning, Regional and Community Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Condition of effectiveness of the Financing Agreement | Description :Recipient has established: (i) the SteeringCommittee, (ii) the National Coordination Unit, and (iii) the eight (8) Regional Coordination Units for the Project, each withattributions, composition and resources acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :04-Sep-2013

Finance Agreement :Condition of effectiveness of the Financing Agreement | Description :Recipient has recruited the following keystaff for the Project, each on the basis of ToRs, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association: (i) a Projectcoordinator; (ii) an administrative and financial specialist; (iii) a senior accountant; (iv) a procurement specialist; (v) amonitoring & evaluation specialist; and (vi) a planning and communal development specialist. | Due Date :04-Sep-2013

Finance Agreement :Condition of effectiveness of the Financing Agreement | Description :The Recipient has revised for the Project,approved and disseminated to the entities involved in the implementation of the Project:(i) the Project Implementation Manual, (ii)the Administrative, Accounting and Financial Procedures Manual, and (iii) the Monitoringand Evaluation Manual, each in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :04-Sep-2013

Finance Agreement :Dated Covenant | Description :Recipient shall have its financial statements audited each year and the auditedstatements shall be furnished to the Association not later than six months after the end of the Recipient fiscal year. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Dated Covenant | Description :Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association not later than forty-five(45) days after the end of each calendar quarter, interim unaudited financial reports for the Project covering the quarter, in formand substance satisfactory to the Association | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Dated covenant | Description :Mid Term Review: Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association not lessthan 3 months prior to the beginning of the Mid-term Review, a report integrating the results of the monitoring and evaluationactivities, on the progress achieved in carrying out the Project during the period preceding the date of such report and the actionplan for the remaining period to achieve the project PDO. | Due Date :23-Aug-2015
Finance Agreement :Dated covenant | Description :Recipient shall engage independent auditors for the purpose not later than four(4) months after the Effective Date. | Due Date :04-Jan-2014

Finance Agreement :Dated covenant | Description :Recipient shall furnish to the Association, not later than December 15 of eachyear, the annual work program and budget approved bythe Steering Committee except the annual work program of the first year whichshould be submitted one month after effectiveness. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Dated covenant | Description :Recipient shall have updated the Simplified Procedure Manual in form and substancesatisfactory to the Association for the Project and disseminated it to the Targeted Communes. | Due Date :23-Dec-2013

Finance Agreement :Dated covenant | Description :Recipient shall have upgraded its accounting software in a manner satisfactory tothe Association to ensure the timely production of the financial reports | Due Date :23-Nov-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II. B. 1. (b) (ii) of the Financing Agreement | Description :Without limitation to thegenerality of the provisions in paragraph (a) immediately above, no later than (3) three months after effective date or such otherdate as the Association may agree in writing, the Recipient shall (ii) have hired two regional accountants and one regionalinternal auditor. | Due Date :28-Feb-2018

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II. B. 1. (b) (iii) of the Financing Agreement | Description :Without limitation to thegenerality of the provisions in paragraph (a) immediately above, no later than (3) three months after effective date or such otherdate as the Association may agree in writing, the Recipient shall (iii) have reviewed the terms of reference and contact of theexternal auditor. | Due Date :28-Feb-2018

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section II. B. 1. (b) (i) of the Financing Agreement | Description :Without limitation to thegenerality of the provisions in paragraph (a) immediately above, no later than (3) three months after effective date or such otherdate as the Association may agree in writing, the Recipient shall (i) have reconfigured its accounting software. | Due Date:28-Feb-2018

title.narrative: IRM established and ready to provide access to financial resources to Niger in case of an eligible emergency
Targeted communes whose planning and AIP sessions are public
Targeted communes utilizing at least 80% of their investment allocations
Populations of newly targeted communes whose access to education improved
Targeted inter-communal initiatives which have been implemented
Populations (disaggregated by gender) of newly targeted communes whose access to nutrition services improved
Representatives of key Regional agencies whose planning capacities have been strengthened
Targeted communes which have protected and/or restored at least 200 hectares of land
Beneficiaries whose income increased by 30% because of farm and off-farm jobs created by approved micro-projects
Targeted knowledge & communication products prepared and disseminated
Commune whose approved micro-projects integrate gender equity
Targeted Communes that have defined and implemented good governance practices (participation, accountability, and equity)
Representatives of deconcentrated line departments whose local development-related capacities have been strengthened
Targeted communes that timely prepare annual financial reports (with legal delays)
Communes whose grievance mechanisms have been created and are operational
Targeted communes that are enabled to sustain proper operation and maintenance of local development investment
Targeted communes that are enabled to sustain proper operation and maintenance of local development investments
Increase in agricultural productivity of major crops - (tomato, cassava, onions, pepper)
Beneficiaries that have increased consumption of fruits and vegetables
Farmers reached with agricultural assets or services
Farmers adopting improved agricultural technology - Female
Farmers reached with agricultural assets or services - Female
Area provided with new/improved irrigation or drainage services
Increase in agricultural productivity of major crops - cassava
Increase in agricultural productivity of major crops - peppers
Increase in agricultural productivity of major crops - onions
Increase in agricultural productivity of major crops - tomatoes
